item.title: How BBC visualize data?
item.description: if(!require("pacman")) install.packages("pacman") ## Loading required package: pacman p_load("tidyverse", "bbplot", "readxl", "viridis", "wesanderson") ## Installing package into 'C:/Users/Habac/Documents/R/win-library/3.5' ## (as 'lib' is unspecified) ## Warning: unable to access index for repository http://www.stats.ox.ac.uk/pub/RWin/bin/windows/contrib/3.5: ## no fue posible abrir la URL 'http://www.stats.ox.ac.uk/pub/RWin/bin/windows/contrib/3.5/PACKAGES' ## package 'wesanderson' successfully unpacked and MD5 sums checked ## ## The downloaded binary packages are in ## C:\Users\Habac\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpaG8SHD\downloaded_packages ## ## wesanderson installed imdb_tbl <- read.

item.title: Data Vis: Teoría & Practica
item.description: Insert Lead paragraph here. A augue nunc lacus auctor efficitur tempor placerat, dictum volutpat mi vitae viverra porta non sem, himenaeos senectus vivamus potenti cubilia sollicitudin. Curae cursus inceptos tincidunt magna mi nibh ad enim etiam, molestie eu quis primis hendrerit taciti phasellus. Feugiat ultricies dictumst iaculis potenti odio laoreet urna at, ultrices curae leo accumsan proin sem lobortis.

item.title: ggplot2 in a nutshell
item.description: Why this post? Some time ago Dina Pomeranz posted on twitter a brief article about how the gender gaps has been falling in most countries, if you don’t believe me: The unadjusted gender wage gap for full time workers has been falling significantly in most countries: https://t.co/k7olIo40ZA pic.twitter.com/uknetWXajw — Dina D.
